maml:description.maml:para: Add an certificate which will be used as application certificate

The Add-AzureRmServiceFabricApplicationCertificate installs the certificate to the all nodetypes in the cluster, either from existing Azure key vault or creating an new Azure key vault using existing certificate provided or from an new self signed certificate created

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
The Dns name of the certificate to be created
Azure key vault name
Azure key vault resource group name
The password of the pfx file
The destination path of the new Pfx file to be created
Azure key vault secret name, if not specified, it will use the new or existing certificate name
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
The Dns name of the certificate to be created
Azure key vault resource id
The password of the pfx file
The destination path of the new Pfx file to be created
Azure key vault secret name, if not specified, it will use the new or existing certificate name
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
The thumprint for the Azure key vault secret
The existing Azure key vault secret uri
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
Azure key vault name
Azure key vault resource group name
The password of the pfx file
The existing Pfx file path
Azure key vault secret name, if not specified, it will use the new or existing certificate name
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
Azure key vault resource id
The password of the pfx file
The existing Pfx file path
Azure key vault secret name, if not specified, it will use the new or existing certificate name
The Dns name of the certificate to be created
The thumprint for the Azure key vault secret
Specifies the name of the cluster
Azure key vault name
Azure key vault resource group name
Azure key vault resource id
The password of the pfx file
The destination path of the new Pfx file to be created
The existing Pfx file path
Specifies the name of the resource group.
The existing Azure key vault secret uri
Azure key vault secret name, if not specified, it will use the new or existing certificate name

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS c:> Add-AzureRmServiceFabricApplicationCertificate -ResourceGroupName 'Group1' -ClusterName 'Contoso01SFCluster' -SecretUrl 'https://contoso03vault.vault.azure.net/secrets/contoso03vaultrg/7f7de9131c034172b9df37ccc549524f' -CertificateThumprint 5F3660C715EBBDA31DB1FFDCF508302348DE8E7A

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will add a certificate from existing Azure key vault to all node types of the cluster named myCluster

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS c:\> $pwd = ConvertTo-SecureString -String "123" -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> Add-AzureRmServiceFabricApplicationCertificate -ResourceGroupName 'Group2' -ClusterName 'Contoso02SFCluster' -KeyVaultName 'Contoso02Vault' -KeyVaultResouceGroupName 'Contoso02VaultRg' -PfxDestinationFile 'c:\newcert.pfx' -Password $pwd -CertificateDnsName 'Contoso.com''

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will add certificate by creating an new self signed certificate and uploading to Azure key vault, then installs to all node types of the cluster

maml:description.maml:para: Add common name or thumbprint to the cluster for client authentication
The Add-AzureRmServiceFabricClientCertificate can add common name and issuer thumbprint or certificate thumbprint to the cluster, so that the client can use it for authentication

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
Specify client certificate common name
Specify client certificate issuer thumbprint
Client authentication type
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
Specify client common name and issuer thumbprint(use ';' to separate) and flag
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
Specify client certificate thumbprint
Client authentication type
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
Specify client certificate thumbprint and flag
Specifies the name of the cluster
Specify client certificate common name
Specify client common name and issuer thumbprint(use ';' to separate) and flag
Client authentication type
Specify client certificate issuer thumbprint
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specify client certificate thumbprint
Specify client certificate thumbprint and flag

maml:description.maml:para: System.String System.Boolean

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS c:> Add-AzureRmServiceFabricApplicationCertificate -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup -ClusterName myCluster -Thumbprint 5F3660C715EBBDA31DB1FFDCF508302348DE8E7A -IsAdmin true

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will add thumbprint with 5F3660C715EBBDA31DB1FFDCF508302348DE8E7A to the cluster, and its role is admin, so the client use the certificate to communicate with the cluster

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $table=@{"abc.com;AF06E4BFCBA05DCB59C42720136EC19DBA0A8E9F"="true";"testdomain.com;5F3660C715EBBDA31DB1FFDCF508302348DE8E7A"="false"} PS C:\> Add-AzureRmServiceFabricClientCertificate -CommonNameIssuersAndFlags $table -ClusterName testclusterpowershell2 -ResourceGroupName newsftestrg2

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will add two client certificates one with admin access , the other one with readyonly acess by common name and issuer thumbprint to the cluster

maml:description.maml:para: Add a secondary cluster certificate to the cluster

The Add-AzureRmServiceFabricClusterCertificate add a secondary cluster certificate, either from existing Azure key vault or creating an new Azure key vault using existing certificate provided or from an new self signed certificate created It will override the secondary cluster if there is any.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
The Dns name of the certificate to be created
Azure key vault name
Azure key vault resource group name
The password of the pfx file
The destination path of the new Pfx file to be created
Azure key vault secret name, if not specified, it will use the new or existing certificate name

Specifies the name of the cluster
The Dns name of the certificate to be created
Azure key vault resource id
The password of the pfx file
The destination path of the new Pfx file to be created

Specifies the name of the cluster
The thumprint for the Azure key vault secret
The existing Azure key vault secret uri

Specifies the name of the cluster

Azure key vault resource group name
The password of the pfx file
The existing Pfx file path

Specifies the name of the cluster

The password of the pfx file
The existing Pfx file path
Azure key vault secret name, if not specified, it will use the new or existing certificate name
The Dns name of the certificate to be created
The thumprint for the Azure key vault secret
Specifies the name of the cluster

Azure key vault resource id
The password of the pfx file
The destination path of the new Pfx file to be created
The existing Pfx file path
Specifies the name of the resource group.
The existing Azure key vault secret uri
Azure key vault secret name, if not specified, it will use the new or existing certificate name

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: Add-AzureRmServiceFabricClusterCertificate -ResourceGroupName 'Group1' -ClusterName 'Contoso01SFCluster' -SecretUrl 'https://contoso03vault.vault.azure.net/secrets/contoso03vaultrg/7f7de9131c034172b9df37ccc549524f' -CertificateThumprint 5F3660C715EBBDA31DB1FFDCF508302348DE8E7A

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will add a certificate in the existing Azure key vault, and upgrade the certificate as secondary cluster certificate

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS c:\> $pwd = ConvertTo-SecureString -String "123" -AsPlainText -Force PS c:\> add-AzureRmServiceFabricClusterCertificate -ResourceGroupName 'Group2' -ClusterName 'Contoso02SFCluster' -KeyVaultName 'Contoso02Vault' -KeyVaultResouceGroupName 'Contoso02VaultRg' -PfxDestinationFile 'c:\newcert.pfx' -Password $pwd -CertificateDnsName 'Contoso.com'

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will add certificate by creating an new self signed certificate and uploading to Azure key vault, and upgrade the certificate as secondary cluster certificate

maml:description.maml:para: Add nodes to the specific node type
The Add-AzureRmServiceFabricNodes can add nodes to the specific node type

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
VM instance number
Node type name
Specifies the name of the cluster
Node type name
VM instance number
Specifies the name of the resource group.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS c:> Add-AzureRmServiceFabricNodes -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup -ClusterName myCluster -NumberOfNodesToAdd 2 -NodeTypeName n1

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will add 2 nodes to the node type of n1

maml:description.maml:para: Add a node type to the existing cluster
Add a new node type to the cluster

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
The node type name
The sku name
Tier
Capacity
The user name for login to Vm
The password of login to the Vm
Capacity
Specifies the name of the cluster
The node type name
Specifies the name of the resource group.
The sku name
Tier
The password of login to the Vm
The user name for login to Vm

maml:description.maml:para: System.Int32

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Add-AzureRmServiceFabricNodeType -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup -ClusterName myCluster -NodeTypeName n2 -Capacity 5 -VmUserName adminName -VmPassword User@123

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will add a new node type n2 with capacity with 5, and the vm admin username is adminName password is User@123

maml:description.maml:para: Get the cluster resource
The Add-AzureRmServiceFabricCluster will get the cluster resource

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
Specifies the name of the cluster
Specifies the name of the resource group.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmServiceFabricCluster -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup -ClusterName myCluster

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will get the cluster resource with the name myCluster

maml:description.maml:para: Create an new ServiceFabric cluster

The New-AzureRmServiceFabricCluster can deploy an new cluster or update the cluster using Azure resource template The template file can only be secure cluster template. You don't need to input the certificate information in the parameter file, it will place the information from parameters into the template file directly

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group.
The Dns name of the certificate to be created
Azure key vault resource id
The deployment mode.
The password of the pfx file
The destination path of the new Pfx file to be created
Azure key vault secret name, if not specified, it will use the new or existing certificate name
The path of the template file.
The path of the template parameter file.

The Dns name of the certificate to be created

The deployment mode.

The deployment mode.
The password of the pfx file

The existing Azure key vault secret uri
Azure key vault secret name, if not specified, it will use the new or existing certificate name
The path of the template file.
The path of the template parameter file.

maml:description.maml:para: Microsoft.Azure.Management.ResourceManager.Models.DeploymentMode

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS c:\> $pwd = ConvertTo-SecureString -String "123" -AsPlainText -Force PS c:\> New-AzureRmServiceFabricCluster -ResourceGroupName 'Group1' -KeyVaultName 'Contoso01Vault' -KeyVaultResouceGroupName 'Contoso01VaultRg' -Source c:\existingPfx.pfx -Password $pwd -TemplateFile c:\template.json -TemplateParameterFile c:\parameters.json

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will upload an existing certificate to Azure key vault, and uses it and Azure resource templdate to deploy a ServiceFabric cluster

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS c:\> $pwd = ConvertTo-SecureString -String "123" -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> New-AzureRmServiceFabricCluster -ResourceGroupName 'Group2' -KeyVaultName 'Contoso02Vault' -KeyVaultResouceGroupName 'Contoso02VaultRg' -PfxDestinationFile 'c:\newcert.pfx' -TemplateFile 'c:\template.json' -TemplateParameterFile 'c:\parameters.json' -CertificateDnsName 'mydns.com' -Password $pwd

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will create a self signed certificate with Dns name provided, and upload to Azure key vault, and uses it and ARM templdate to deploy a ServiceFabric cluster

command:example.maml:title: Example 3
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmServiceFabricCluster -ResourceGroupName 'Group3' -TemplateFile 'c:\template.json' -TemplateParameterFile c:\parameters.json -SecretUrl 'https://contoso03vault.vault.azure.net/secrets/contoso03vaultrg/7f7de9131c034172b9df37ccc549524f' -CertificateThumprint 'AF06E4BFCBA05DCB59C42720136EC19DBA0A8E9F'

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will deploy an new ServiceFabric cluster using existing Azure key vault and Azure resource template

command:example.maml:title: Example 4
command:example.dev:code: PS c:\> $pwd = ConvertTo-SecureString -String "123" -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> New-AzureRmServiceFabricCluster -TemplateFile 'c:\template.json' -TemplateParameterFile 'c:\parameters.json' -KeyVaultResouceId '/subscriptions/13ad2c84-84fa-4798-ad71-e70c07af873f/resoceGroups/contoso03vaultrg/providers/Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/contoso03vault' -PfxSourceFile 'c:\pfx.pfx' -Password $pwd -ResourceGroupName 'Group4'

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will upload an existing certificate to Azure key vault, and uses it and Azure resource templdate to deploy a ServiceFabric cluster

maml:description.maml:para: Remove client certificate from the cluster
The Remove-AzureRmServiceFabricClientCertificate can remove the certificate either by common name and issuer thumbprint or certificate thumbprint

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
Specify client certificate common name
Specify client certificate issuer thumbprint
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
Specify client common name and issuer thumbprint(use ';' to separate) and flag
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
Specify client certificate thumbprint
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
Specify client certificate thumbprint and flag
Specifies the name of the cluster
Specify client certificate common name
Specify client common name and issuer thumbprint(use ';' to separate) and flag
Specify client certificate issuer thumbprint
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specify client certificate thumbprint
Specify client certificate thumbprint and flag

maml:description.maml:para: System.String System.Boolean

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS c:> Remove-AzureRmServiceFabricApplicationCertificate -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup -ClusterName myCluster -Thumbprint 5F3660C715EBBDA31DB1FFDCF508302348DE8E7A

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will remove thumbprint 5F3660C715EBBDA31DB1FFDCF508302348DE8E7A from the cluster

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS c:> $table = @{"abc.com;AF06E4BFCBA05DCB59C42720136EC19DBA0A8E9F"=$true} PS c:>Remove-AzureRmServiceFabricClientCertificate -CommonNameIssuersAndFlags $table -ClusterName myclustername -ResourceGroupName myresourcegroup

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will remove common name with abc.com and issue thumbprint with 5F3660C715EBBDA31DB1FFDCF508302348DE8E7A from the cluster

maml:description.maml:para: Remove cluster certificate
The Remove-AzureRmServiceFabricClusterCertificate can remove a secondary cluster certificate from the cluster

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
Specify the cluster thumbprint which to be removed
Specifies the name of the cluster
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specify the cluster thumbprint which to be removed

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Remove-AzureRmServiceFabricClusterCertificate -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup -ClusterName myCluster -Thumbprint 5F3660C715EBBDA31DB1FFDCF508302348DE8E7A

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will remove the certificate with thumbprint 5F3660C715EBBDA31DB1FFDCF508302348DE8E7A fromt the cluster certificate

maml:description.maml:para: Remove nodes from the specific node type
The Remove-AzureRmServiceFabricNodes can remove nodes from specific node type

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
Number of nodes to remove
Node type name
Specifies the name of the cluster
Node type name
Number of nodes to remove
Specifies the name of the resource group.

maml:description.maml:para: System.String

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS c:> Remove-AzureRmServiceFabricNodes -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup -ClusterName myCluster -NumberOfNodesToRemove 2 -NodeTypeName n1

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will remove 2 nodes from the node type n1

maml:description.maml:para: Remove a node type from the cluster
The Remove-AzureRmServiceFabricNodeType can remove nodes from specific node type Remove a existing node type from the cluster, note, it can't remove primary node type

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
The node type name
Specifies the name of the cluster
The node type name
Specifies the name of the resource group.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS c:> Remove-AzureRmServiceFabricNodeType -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup -ClusterName myCluster -NodeTypeName n1

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will remove node type n1 from the cluster

maml:description.maml:para: Remove one or multiple ServiceFabric settings from the cluster
The Remove-AzureRmServiceFabricSettings can remove ServiceFabric settings from the cluster

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
Section
Parameter
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
Client authentication type
Specifies the name of the cluster
Parameter
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Section
Client authentication type

maml:description.maml:para: Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ServiceFabric.Models.PSSettingsSectionDescription[]

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS c:> Remove-AzureRmServiceFabricSettings -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup -ClusterName myCluster -Section EseStore -Parameter Maxcursors

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will remove parameter Maxcursors under section EseStore

maml:description.maml:para: Add or update one or multiple ServiceFabric settings to the cluster
The Set-AzureRmServiceFabricSettings can add ServiceFabric settings to the cluster

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
Section
Parameter
Value
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
Client authentication type
Specifies the name of the cluster
Parameter
Specifies the name of the resource group.
Section
Client authentication type
Value

maml:description.maml:para: Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ServiceFabric.Models.PSSettingsSectionDescription[]

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS c:\> Set-AzureRmServiceFabricSettings -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup -ClusterName myCluster -Section EseStore -Parameter Maxcursors -Value 1000

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will Set 'Maxcursors' to value '1000' under the section 'EseStore'

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code:
PS c:\>$settingsSectionDescription1 = New-Object Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ServiceFabric.Models.PSSettingsSectionDescription PS c:\> $settingsSectionDescription1.Name = 'NamingService' PS c:\>$settingsSectionDescription1.Parameters = New-Object "System.Collections.Generic.List[Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ServiceFabric.Models.PSSettingsParameterDescription]"
PS c:\>$parameter1 = New-Object Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ServiceFabric.Models.PSSettingsParameterDescription PS c:\>$parameter1.Name = 'MaxOperationTimeout' PS c:\>$parameter1.Value = '1000'
PS c:\>$parameter2 = New-Object Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ServiceFabric.Models.PSSettingsParameterDescription PS c:\>$parameter2.Name = 'MaxFileOperationTimeout' PS c:\>$parameter2.Value = '900'
PS c:\>$settingsSectionDescription1.Parameters.Add($parameter1) PS c:\>$settingsSectionDescription1.Parameters.Add($parameter2)
PS c:\>$settingsSectionDescription2 = New-Object Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ServiceFabric.Models.PSSettingsSectionDescription PS c:\>$settingsSectionDescription2.Name = 'EseStore' PS c:\>$settingsSectionDescription2.Parameters = New-Object "System.Collections.Generic.List[Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ServiceFabric.Models.PSSettingsParameterDescription]"
PS c:\>$parameter3 = New-Object Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ServiceFabric.Models.PSSettingsParameterDescription PS c:\>$parameter3.Name = 'MaxCursors' PS c:\>$parameter3.Value = '1000'
PS c:\>$settingsSectionDescription2.Parameters.Add($parameter3) PS c:\>$arry=$settingsSectionDescription1 , $settingsSectionDescription2
PS c:\> Set-AzureRmServiceFabricSettings -SettingsSectionDescriptions $arry -ClusterName myclustername -ResourceGroupName clusterresourcegroup

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will batch update fabric settings

maml:description.maml:para: Set ServiceFabric upgrade type of the cluster
The Set-AzureRmServiceFabricUpgradeType set upgrade type to automatic or manual with specific ServiceFabric code version

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
ClusterUpgradeMode
Cluster code version
Specifies the name of the cluster
Specifies the name of the resource group.
ClusterUpgradeMode
Cluster code version

maml:description.maml:para: System.String

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS c:> Set-AzureRmServiceFabricUpgradeType -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup -ClusterName myCluster -UpgradeMode Automatic

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will set the cluster upgrade mode to automatic

maml:description.maml:para: Update durability of the cluster
The Update-AzureRmServiceFabricDurability can update durability and SKU of the cluter

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
DurabilityLevel
NodeTypeName
SkuName
Specifies the name of the cluster
DurabilityLevel
NodeTypeName
Specifies the name of the resource group.
SkuName

maml:description.maml:para: System.String

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS c:> Update-AzureRmServiceFabricDurability -ResourceGroupName clusterresourcegroup -ClusterName mycluster -Level Silver -NodeTypeName nt1

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will change durability level of the node type 'nt1' to silver

maml:description.maml:para: Update reliability of the cluster
The Update-AzureRmServiceFabricReliability can update reliability of the cluster

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group.
Specifies the name of the cluster
VM instance number
Automatic adjust nodes number when changing reliability
Automatic adjust nodes number when changing reliability
Specifies the name of the cluster
VM instance number
Specifies the name of the resource group.

maml:description.maml:para: System.Management.Automation.SwitchParameter System.String

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS c:> Add-AzureRmServiceFabricReliability -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup -ClusterName myCluster -ReliabilityLevel Silver

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will change reliability level of the cluster to silver
